verbs.description: forslack (third-person singular simple present forslacks, present participle forslacking, simple past and past participle forslacked)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, rare) To slack up; be or grow slack; pall.
(transitive, obsolete) To be slack in; neglect by idleness; relax; render slack; delay; lose or spoil by slackness.
examples: The official thinking to foreslacke no time, taking counsell with his fellowes, laide hands uppon this Peter, and brought him before the inquisitor.
